_header: Lordings all and ye will hear
Title(s): ‘How the Wyse Man Tawght His Son’
Subjects: children, instructions for the behavior of; manners, treatises on; instruction, father to son
_description: ‘How the Wyse Man Tawght His Son’ — 20 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Lordynges & ȝe wyll hereHow a wyse man tauȝht hys
                    soneTake god hede to þis matereAnd fynd to lerne it yff ȝe
                    cane…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…And Ihesu bryng vs to his blysseThe chyld þat w[as] in
                    bedlem borne
BodAsh61.Note:
Omits stanzas 6-11, first half of 13, and 14. The poem has 100 lines and
                    appears to have been edited to make the number of lines equal one hundred. At
                    the end: ‘Amen quod Rate’.

BLHar2399.First Lines:
Lordynges all & ȝe will hereHow a wys man tawgh hys
                    sone…
BLHar2399.Last Lines:
…Be hym lef or by hym lothAt on day a pere man scha haue a
                    moch as he
